ICU Admission.description: The event of a patient being admitted to an Intensive Care Unit (ICU)

Severity of Illness.description: The seriousness of a patient's medical condition requiring ICU-level care

Availability of Resources.description: The availability of resources such as beds and staff within the ICU

Underlying Medical Conditions.description: Pre-existing health conditions that contribute to the severity of illness

Acute Illness Onset.description: The sudden onset of a serious illness or injury

Chronic Diseases.description: Long-term health conditions that increase the risk of ICU admission

Genetic Predisposition.description: Inherited factors influencing susceptibility to severe illness

Trauma.description: Physical injuries resulting from accidents or violence

Infection.description: Infections causing severe illness requiring ICU care

Hospital Bed Capacity.description: The number of available ICU beds in the hospital

ICU Staffing Levels.description: The number of ICU staff available to care for patients

Diabetes.description: Metabolic disorder affecting blood sugar regulation

Family History.description: Presence of similar conditions in family members

Patient Discharge Rate.description: Rate at which patients leave the ICU

Hospital Size.description: Physical size and capacity of the hospital

Physician Availability.description: Number of physicians available in the ICU
